channel.title: Ehsan Hajyasini's Learning Journal
channel.description: Recent content on Ehsan Hajyasini's Learning Journal

item.title: French Mother Sauces
item.description: There are 5 main french sauces: Espagnole, Velouté, Tomato, Béchamel, Hollandaise (Mayonnaise) Everything else is considered a derivative (daugther sauce). Alex (the french guy) has a great series on them. There is also this Wikipedia page. culinary sauces

item.title: Haskell
item.description: It is quite easy to get a grasp on it if you have prior exprience with functional languages such as perl. There is this video which covers a lot of material. It also refrences this book. programming-languages functional

item.title: Arbitage and Latency In Exchanges
item.description: Every microsecond is important in exchanges. So they are willing to spend millions of dollors on minimizing it. The $300 Million Cable Between New York and Chicago exchange latency

item.title: JVM and Exchanges
item.description: Efficient Architectures for Low Latency and High Throughput Trading Systems on the JVM exchange latency

item.title: Java JVM GC Analysis
item.description: A host of GC Analysis Tools GC Easy JMC GCGC Heapothesys java latency

item.title: Reducing System Jitter
item.description: “CPU isolation and thread affinity are powerful tools that can help reduce runtime jitter introduced by the OS scheduler. Linux tracing tools such as perf_events are invaluable for inspecting the state of running processes when determining sources of jitter. For low-latency applications, orders-of-magnitude reductions in jitter can be achieved by applying these techniques.” – From Mark Price’s Personal Blog He was part of the LMAX Exchange team. His blog contains a multitude of greate performance oriented posts.

item.title: Debugging Performance
item.description: This is a great performance debugging tale in LMAX Exchange posted on James Byatt’s blog. It deals with page faults and digs deep using system tracing and performance tools. latency

item.title: Insights into Trading System Dynamic
item.description: An Extensive look into the performance profile of the Deutsche Börse’s T7® trading system. latency exchange

item.title: Low Latency Java: LMAX and Azul
item.description: Gil Tene is the CTO of Azul Systems which created one of the most powerful garbage collectors and JVMs in the java world. In this talk he talks about Low Latency Java in the Real World and the lessons learned and techniques used in the LMAX Exchange with the Zing JVM. latency java

item.title: Faster Objects and Arrays
item.description: Gil Tene presents Faster Objects and Arrays which should make their performance closer to C language. latency java

item.title: Art of Benchmarking (in Java)
item.description: “Aleksey Shipilёv is working on Java performance for 10+ years. Today he is employed by Red Hat, where he does OpenJDK development and performance work.” In These presentations he talks about benchmarking The Art of Java Benchmarking Java Benchmarking as easy as two timestamps benchmark java

item.title: The Many Meanings of Event-Driven Architecture
item.description: Martin Fowler clarifies what event driven means and dives in to event sourcing and CQRS pattern in this talk. software architecture

item.title: Domain Driven Design in Java
item.description: A great example of using value objects: Power Use of Value Objects in DDD Value Objects in DDD can be implemented using any of these libraries in java: Google Auto Project Lombok A Complete DDD Enterprise Application Example in Java. It also includes some Hexagonal architecture. DDD by Example DDD architecture java
